      • surface

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: SurfaceImage
        Destroys the texture underlying this surface image and frees up the associated GPU memory. This will happen automatically when this image is garbage collected, but this can ensure that the memory is freed at a predictable time. Warning: if you destroy a surface image that is currently being displayed by an image layer, bad things will happen. Don't do that.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface SurfaceImage

      • addCallback

        public void addCallback(Callback<? super Image> callback)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Adds a callback to be notified when this image has loaded. If the image is already loaded, the callback will be notified immediately; otherwise on the main playn thread at a later time. The callback is discarded once the image is loaded.
        Specified by:
        addCallback in interface Image

      • subImage

        public Image.Region subImage(float sx,
                    float sy,
                    float swidth,
                    float sheight)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Returns an image that draws the specified sub-region of this image.
        Specified by:
        subImage in interface Image
        Overrides:
        subImage in class AbstractImageGL<Object>
        Parameters:
        sx - the x offset (in pixels) of the subimage.
        sy - the y offset (in pixels) of the subimage.
        swidth - the width (in pixels) of the subimage.
        sheight - the height (in pixels) of the subimage.

      • ensureTexture

        public int ensureTexture()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Creates a texture for this image (if one does not already exist) and returns its OpenGL texture id. Returns 0 if the underlying image data is not yet ready or if this platform does not use OpenGL. The texture will remain in GPU memory until Image.clearTexture() is called or this image is garbage collected.

        Note: this texture handle should not be held for longer than the scope of the enclosing function call. It is not safe to hang onto an image's texture handle as the image may delete its texture and recreate it under any number of circumstances.

        Specified by:
        ensureTexture in interface Image

      • clearTexture

        public void clearTexture()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Clears the GPU texture associated with this image, on platforms implemented via OpenGL. Does nothing on non-OpenGL platforms. In general it is not necessary to call this method. Images added to ImageLayer instances automatically clear their texture when the image layer is removed from the scene graph. Textures are also cleared when the image is garbage collected. However, if you manually call Image.ensureTexture(), or if you draw images to a Surface, you may wish to clear textures manually to avoid running out of GPU memory before garbage collection has a chance to run and clear the textures for you.
        Specified by:
        clearTexture in interface Image
